intro: Gisekia pentadecandra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to white. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Gisekia pentadecandra prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
